In about less than a month, the E2E Virtualization conference will kick off, this time in Rome (Italy) from November 1-3

<a href="http://www.e2evc.com/home" target="_blank"><img alt="" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," width="167" height="50" /></a>

E2EVC (formerly known as PubForum) is a non-commercial, community driven event taking place in EuropeanÂ cities usually twiceÂ a year (US event planned in 2014).Â Started in 2003 with 4 people, each conference is nowadays joined by around 120 to 150 IT pros and geeksÂ from allÂ over the world delivering level 400 session content back to the community. The event is also well recognized by vendors, while some of them continue to sponsor the event all over the years. This time we will have 18 MVPs, 15 CTPs andÂ 6 vExperts on board, making the event a true andÂ uniqueÂ Expert-to-Expert happening. I have the honor to deliver two sessions this time.

  * Server 2012 R2 (new key features)
  * System Center Virtual Machine Manager 2012 R2 (this session is co-delivered with MVP and fellow geek <a href="http://www.thomasmaurer.ch" target="_blank">Thomas Maurer)</a>

For the complete session schedule refer to the following <a href="http://www.e2evc.com/home/Agenda.aspx" target="_blank">link</a>

There are a few seats left, so hurry up and <a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=GPX27MEHB9WFY" target="_blank">get one of the last tickets</a> to the one and only virtualization-know-how-exchange and -networking event.

You can also have a look at some of the past session recordings <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/ThePubForum/videos" target="_blank">here</a>.

See you in Rome!
